classic.name: El Retiro Park
classic.description: Expansive, 19th-century park with boating lake & rose garden, plus numerous fountains & statues.

classic.name: Museo Nacional del Prado
classic.description: Art museum with Velazquez, Goya and El Greco masterpieces in vast 12th- to 19th-century collection.

classic.name: Royal Palace of Madrid
classic.description: 18th-century, ridge-top palace for state occasions, plus tours with rooms full of art and antiques.

classic.name: Puerta de Alcalá
classic.description: Triumphal arch near to Parque del Buen Retiro & rich with stone carvings & elegant sculptures.
classic.address: Pl. de la Independencia, s/n, Retiro, 28001 Madrid, Spain

classic.name: Thyssen-Bornemisza National Museum
classic.description: Museum housing collection of 13th-20th-century European masterpieces, from Renaissance to Pop Art.
classic.address: P.º del Prado, 8, Centro, 28014 Madrid, Spain

classic.name: National Museum of Archaeology
classic.description: Neoclassical building housing ancient & more modern artifacts including cave art & Islamic pottery.
classic.address: C. de Serrano, 13, Salamanca, 28001 Madrid, Spain

classic.name: Cibeles Fountain
classic.description: 18th century neoclassical fountain depicting the goddess Cybele on a chariot pulled by 2 lions.
classic.address: Pl. Cibeles, S/N, Centro, 28014 Madrid, Spain

classic.name: Royal Basilica of Saint Francis the Great
classic.description: Imposing neoclassical church with vast frescoed dome & chapel painted by Goya, plus guided tours.
classic.address: C. de San Buenaventura, 1, Centro, 28005 Madrid, Spain

classic.name: Bernabéu
classic.description: 81,000-capacity ground for Real Madrid, with regular matches plus tours of stadium and trophy room.
classic.address: Av. de Concha Espina, 1, Chamartín, 28036 Madrid, Spain

classic.name: Plaza Mayor
classic.description: Cafes & restaurants line the arches of this stately square with Philip III's statue in the center.

foodie.name: Casto - Obrador y Café de especialidad
foodie.address: C. de Víctor Hugo, 5, Centro, 28004 Madrid, Spain

foodie.name: Alma Nomad Bakery
foodie.address: C. de Sta. Feliciana, 10, Chamberí, 28010 Madrid, Spain

foodie.name: Movistar Arena Madrid
foodie.address: Av. de Felipe II, s/n, Salamanca, 28009 Madrid, Spain

foodie.name: 99 Cheesecake | Malasaña
foodie.address: C. de Don Felipe, 4, Centro, 28004 Madrid, Spain

foodie.name: Bar La Campana
foodie.description: No-frills urban tavern known for fried calamari sandwiches, plus classic tapas dishes & sangria.
foodie.address: C. de Botoneras, 6, Centro, 28012 Madrid, Spain

foodie.name: Hotel Riu Plaza España
foodie.description: Sleek property featuring dining, a rooftop bar & a seasonal outdoor pool, plus chic quarters.

foodie.name: X-Madrid
foodie.description: Cool mall offering many shops & eateries in a huge, industrial-style setting with several levels.

foodie.name: Centro Comercial Islazul
foodie.address: C. de la Calderilla, 1, Carabanchel, 28054 Madrid, Spain

foodie.name: Chocolatería San Ginés
foodie.description: Founded in 1894, this cafe is known for its chocolate with churros.
foodie.address: Pasadizo de San Ginés, 5, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain

foodie.name: BOTIN
foodie.description: Spanish fixture open since 1725, famous for its roast suckling pig mentioned in a Hemingway novel.
foodie.address: C. de Cuchilleros, 17, Centro, 28005 Madrid, Spain

adventure.name: El Retiro Park
adventure.description: Expansive, 19th-century park with boating lake & rose garden, plus numerous fountains & statues.

adventure.name: Estanque Grande del Retiro
adventure.description: Central pond in El Retiro Park with a colonnaded monument, popular for rental rowboats & canoes.
adventure.address: P.º de Colombia, 2, Retiro, 28016 Madrid, Spain

adventure.name: Parque Juan Carlos I
adventure.description: Urban oasis with a lake, olive grove, skating rink, free train rides & many modern sculptures.
adventure.address: GLORIETA S.A.R. DON JUAN DE BORBON Y BATTEMBERG, 5 , 5, Barajas, 28042 Madrid, Spain

adventure.name: Jardín del Capricho
adventure.description: Manicured 18th-century landscaped gardens with sculptures, water features & a Civil War bunker.
adventure.address: P.º de la Alameda de Osuna, 25, Barajas, 28042 Madrid, Spain

adventure.name: Casa de Campo
adventure.description: Expansive park & former royal hunting ground, with small hills, streams & a boating lake.
adventure.address: P.º de la Prta del Ángel, 1, 28011 Madrid, Spain

adventure.name: Parque Enrique Tierno Galván
adventure.description: This scenic tree-filled park features a pond, fountains & gardens, along with a planetarium.

adventure.name: Parque de la Quinta de los Molinos
adventure.description: Former estate-turned-park, popular for its grove of blooming almond trees in springtime.
adventure.address: C. Alcalá, 527, San Blas-Canillejas, 28027 Madrid, Spain

adventure.name: Parque del Oeste
adventure.description: Expansive, landscaped, 20th-century urban park with paths meandering past conifer & cedar trees.
adventure.address: P.º de Moret, 2, Moncloa - Aravaca, 28008 Madrid, Spain

adventure.name: Saint Isidore Park
adventure.description: Tree-filled public park used for local festivals, with palm garden, lakes & fountains.
adventure.address: P.º de la Ermita del Santo, 74, Carabanchel, 28019 Madrid, Spain

adventure.name: Berlin Park
adventure.description: Leafy park with playgrounds, woods and fountains plus mementos from the fall of the Berlin Wall.
adventure.address: Av. de Ramón y Cajal, 2, Chamartín, 28016 Madrid, Spain

cultural.name: Teatro Real
cultural.description: Renowned opera house established in 1850 with frequent performances, guided tours & a grand design.

cultural.name: Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía
cultural.description: Sprawling museum for Spanish 20th-century art collection with works by Gris, Dali, Picasso & Miro.
